New Records: Sri Lanka secured a first ODI bilateral series win against India in 27 years
Dunith Wellalage picked up a five-for as Sri Lanka won by 110 runs
Key Match Events: Avishka Fernando struck 96 - the highest individual score this series
Riyan Parag grabbed the key wicket of Avishka, getting a leg break to slide on into his front pad
Dunith Wellalage had Rohit Sharma caught behind trying to sweep
Pre-Game Insights: Experts noted India's struggles against spin over the past week, losing nine wickets to spinners for the third game straight
Rohit Sharma emphasized India's need to seriously look at their batting against spin
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed concern over India's batting against spin
Charith Asalanka reflected on Sri Lanka's top-order contributions as a sign of them maturing
Miscellaneous Highlights: Avishka Fernando's innings was not a case of Sri Lanka playing spin considerably better than the opposition, rather finding a way to maximise the opportunities afforded by the seamers
Sri Lanka's spinners ended India's 27-year streak of not losing a bilateral ODI series to them
